**Metallica's "Black Album"**

Metallica's fifth album, called the "Black Album," came out in 1991. It was made in Los Angeles with producer Bob Rock and had a different sound from their earlier work, slower and heavier. The album includes famous songs like "Enter Sandman" and "Nothing Else Matters." It was a big success, topping charts in many countries and selling over 30 million copies worldwide. In 2020, it was ranked 235th on Rolling Stone's list of greatest albums.
